title: No Rate Limiting on https://██████/██████████/accounts/password/reset/ endpoint leads to Denial of Service
vulnerability_information:
**Summary:**

No-Rate Limit on Password reset endpoint results mail-spam functionality to be abused.
Additionally, the password-reset link remain the same after each request.

**Description:**

Malicious user could Spear-target █████████ user mail and Spam it for as many requests as he would like.


Possible scenarios:
Attacker could use this vulnerability to bomb out the email inbox of the victim.
Attacker could send Spear-Phishing to the selected mail address.
Attacker might cause denial of service to the mail servers.

## Step-by-step Reproduction Instructions

1. Go to https://█████/█████/accounts/password/reset/
2.  Click on "Send Email" and Capture the request on burp.
3. Send to intruder, and start Sniping attack with NULL payloads.


## Suggested Mitigation/Remediation Actions
1. Limiting the password reset request to once every X minutes.
2. Use CAPTCHA verification after X requests.
3. Asserting random password-reset link for each request.

Similar reports:
https://hackerone.com/reports/764122
https://hackerone.com/reports/791498
https://hackerone.com/reports/441161

Best Regards,

Gal Nagli

## Impact

Attacker could use this vulnerability to bomb out the email inbox of the victim.
Attacker could send Spear-Phishing to the selected mail address.
Attacker might cause denial of service to the mail servers.

activities.message:
Hello, i have examined it further, and found out that there is Unrestricted POST request size, because there is no limit on the mail address you can insert, and because the server will accept any mail, even if it is not registered.
I'm able to craft HIGH requests and no-limit spam those, which slow's the mail servers.

Example report: https://hackerone.com/reports/418254

You could notice at the images i supplied, the content length of 2M at each post request.

activities.message:
Hey, Last comment for now.
The Server has indeed crashed because of the combination of the two problems i have noted above, Maybe we should change the severity because now a DDos won't be a tough task for trained Malicious user.

I'm adding the error 503 code as a picture

it seems that it crashed the whole site, and not only the mail services, only after ~40 requests.

An Error 503 is essentially a sign that the website’s server has been comprised by a temporary overload (or sometimes purposeful maintenance). A DDoS attack (short for Distributed Denial of Service) is when a malicious party flood the bandwidth or resources of a specific system.

Best Regards,

Gal nagli.

activities.message:
Well, few thoughts after taking another look of things.

1. I found out that a legit password reset request returns 302 - Found, and the crafted long request returns 200, it seemed weird. 
after Rendering the page it showed me that there is some sort of attempt to implement letter cap (254 for email) by the developers, but ofcourse it had been bypassed by capturing and crafting the request, as you can see on my images ( i believe the developers didn't mean the server to process the crafted long requests - when you implement a block).

2. I found out that my first 2 accounts, which one got ~850 mails and the other ~350, wont get any more mails, i wonder if the developers blocked my accounts because of my reports here, or i could block anyone's ability to reset his password by bruteforcing his details.

3. I managed to DDOS the website again, checked with another network.
Images are attached.
The "SPIKE" Image shows clearly - requests got stuck, then changed to 5XX, then returned to normal 302.

summaries.content:
While checking for no-rate limiting on password reset page at one of the DoD Websites, I have found a way to leverage the fact that there is no limitation on the input the server will process.
Combining these two Security misconfigurations i have managed to DOS the Website while using Burp Intruder.
